unnormalised: Local student, Rohan Sharma, has reportedly solved the Riemann Hypothesis... or at least, that’s what he *thought* he did. News spread like wildfire after Rohan excitedly shared his “proof” using a rather aggressive amount of LaTeX coding on his social media. Let’s just say, the equation `$E=mc^2$` looked… well, let’s just say it looked lonely amidst a sea of poorly formatted symbols.
normalised: Local student, Rohan Sharma, has reportedly solved the Riemann Hypothesis... or at least, that’s what he thought he did. News spread like wildfire after Rohan excitedly shared his “proof” using a rather aggressive amount of L-A-T-E-X coding on his social media. Let’s just say, the equation E equals m c squared looked… well, let’s just say it looked lonely amidst a sea of poorly formatted symbols.

unnormalised: Apparently, Rohan spent the last 72 hrs straight fueled by chai and sheer willpower (and maybe a little bit of overconfidence) to crack the problem. His code, which clocked in at roughly 1500 lines, included gems like "$\frac{a}{0}$" (which, as we all know, is totally legit) and "$\infty + 1 = \infty$" (profound, really). Peer review, unfortunately, was… harsh.
normalised: Apparently, Rohan spent the last seventy two hours straight fueled by chai and sheer willpower (and maybe a little bit of overconfidence) to crack the problem. His code, which clocked in at roughly one thousand five hundred lines, included gems like a divided by zero (which, as we all know, is totally legit) and infinity plus one equals infinity (profound, really). Peer review, unfortunately, was… harsh.

unnormalised: Prof. Gupta from IIT Delhi delicately pointed out that Rohan's "proof" contained more holes than a Swiss cheese factory. "His use of the `\documentclass{article}` command was the *least* of his problems," Prof. Gupta quipped, adding that Rohan’s attempt to redefine the value of pi to 3.0 was “particularly… innovative.”
normalised: Professor Gupta from I-I-T Delhi delicately pointed out that Rohan's "proof" contained more holes than a Swiss cheese factory. "His use of the documentclass article command was the least of his problems," Professor Gupta quipped, adding that Rohan’s attempt to redefine the value of pi to three point zero was “particularly… innovative.”

unnormalised: Despite the… *constructive criticism*, Rohan remains undeterred. He’s already working on "version 2.0" of his proof, promising even MORE LaTeX and possibly a philosophical debate with infinity itself. We wish him luck. He'll need it. #MathHumor #LaTeXFails #RiemannHypothesis #StudentLife #ChaiPowered
normalised: Despite the… constructive criticism, Rohan remains undeterred. He’s already working on "version two point zero" of his proof, promising even M-O-R-E L-A-T-E-X and possibly a philosophical debate with infinity itself. We wish him luck.
